error.signature: An error occurred (LimitExceededException) when calling the PutRolePolicy: Cannot exceed quota for PolicySize
error.regex: PolicySize.*exceeded|policy.*too large|Cannot exceed quota for Policy

verdict.summary: IAM policy document exceeds 6,144 character limit (inline) or 10,240 (managed).

dead_ends.action: Minify the JSON to reduce character count
dead_ends.why_fails: Minor savings — the real issue is too many permissions

dead_ends.action: Create multiple IAM users with split permissions
dead_ends.why_fails: Complicates management and audit — use policy splitting instead

workarounds.action: Split into multiple managed policies (up to 10 per role/user)
Use wildcards to reduce statement count: s3:Get* instead of listing each action
workarounds.how: s3:Get* instead of listing each action

workarounds.action: Consolidate resources and conditions to reduce policy size
workarounds.how:
Merge multiple statements that share the same Effect and Action into one statement with a Resource array:
{
  "Effect": "Allow",
  "Action": ["s3:GetObject", "s3:PutObject"],
  "Resource": ["arn:aws:s3:::bucket-a/*", "arn:aws:s3:::bucket-b/*"]
}

Use resource wildcards where safe: arn:aws:s3:::my-app-*/* instead of listing each bucket. Remove duplicate or overlapping conditions.

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'An error occurred (LimitExceededException) when ca' is a quota_error error while 'You have requested more vCPU capacity than your cu' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
